column4: I'm using Ubuntu 8.10. I'm having problems getting my optical drive to work. When I insert a blank or a disc with data (dvd-rw, cd-r, cd-rw, cd+r, etc.) the drive opens after a few seconds. I have tried: sudo mount /dev/cdrw /media/cdrom0 sudo mount /dev/cdrom /media/cdrom0 and sudo mount /dev/dvd /media/cdrom0 I also added these to /etc/modules: libata ata_piix piix  fstab and other info --> http://paste.ubuntu.com/152189/
Have you tried isolating the problem? (i.e. boot your computer into BIOS and see if the drive will accept a disk)
no I have not, victim of tunnel vision :P I will try that, ty

I tried inserting a liveCD, the tray closes, then opens and remains open. Rebooted into BIOS with liveCD in the tray, the system shuts down, the tray closes, then opens again when in BIOS. Started normal boot, tray closes then opens again after login.
